headers.description: Content-Security-Policy (CSP) helps prevent various attacks like Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) and data injection attacks by specifying which sources of content are allowed to be loaded. This policy restricts sources to 'self' for scripts and specifies a trusted CDN for additional scripts, while allowing images from any source.

Strict-Transport-Security (HSTS) instructs browsers to only communicate with the server over HTTPS for the specified duration (1 year in this case). This helps prevent man-in-the-middle attacks and ensures secure connections to your site.

X-Content-Type-Options prevents browsers from interpreting files as a different MIME type than specified. This helps mitigate attacks that rely on MIME-type sniffing, such as serving malicious content.

X-Frame-Options prevents your site from being embedded in an iframe. This helps protect against clickjacking attacks, where malicious sites trick users into interacting with hidden elements on your page.

X-XSS-Protection enables the browser's built-in Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) filter, which helps to detect and block XSS attacks. Setting it to 'block' ensures that any detected attacks are not executed.
Referrer-Policy controls how much referrer information is sent with requests. 'no-referrer' ensures that no referrer information is sent, enhancing user privacy.

Permissions-Policy (formerly Feature-Policy) restricts the use of certain browser features like geolocation and camera. Setting 'geolocation=(self)' allows only your site to access geolocation data, while 'camera=()' disallows camera access entirely, reducing the risk of unauthorized data access.
